title: Builder/Assembly Technician
description:
**About Us:**  
At California Closets, we provide our clients with high-quality, custom storage solutions that blend craftsmanship with functional design. Our focus on delivering premium products and white-glove service makes us a leader in the industry. We are seeking a dedicated Builder/Assembly Technician to join our team and help create our signature storage solutions.

**Position Overview:**  
The Builder/Assembly Technician will be responsible for assembling drawer boxes, attaching drawer faces, and installing hardware to complete custom storage units. This role will also assist with loading finished products onto sleds and support quality assurance efforts to ensure all products meet our high standards. Forklift driving and operation would be a plus for this role.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Assemble drawer boxes according to design specifications.
* Attach drawer faces and install hardware (handles, sliders, etc.).
* Assist with loading completed products onto sleds for transportation.
* Perform quality assurance checks to ensure product precision and functionality.
* Follow detailed assembly instructions and work from technical drawings.
* Collaborate with team members to meet production timelines.
* Maintain a clean and organized workspace.
* Assist with inventory management of materials and hardware.
* Adhere to safety guidelines and best practices at all times.

**Additional Skills (Preferred):**

* Forklift driving and operating experience is a plus.

**Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous experience in woodworking, cabinetry, or a similar manufacturing role preferred.
* Ability to read and interpret assembly instructions or technical drawings.
* Proficiency with hand tools and power tools.
* Strong attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team setting.
* Physical ability to lift up to 50 lbs and stand for extended periods.
* Strong adherence to safety and quality standards.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Full-time employment with opportunities for growth and advancement.
* A collaborative and supportive team environment.
* Training and development programs.
* The opportunity to work with a respected leader in custom storage solutions.

title: Summer 2025 Internship - Identity and Access Intern
description:
**Job Description:**


Summer 2025 Internship - Identity and Access Intern


**Application Deadline** : November 15, 2024


We encourage you to submit your application as soon as you can as internship applications are reviewed on a rolling basis.


**Internship Dates** : June 9, 2025 - August 15, 2025 (You must be available to work during this


period)


**About our Organization:**


Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).


**About the Role:**


As part of our growth strategy, we are looking for a highly motivated intern to join our Identity and Access team. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience with Single Sign-On (SSO) systems and contribute to the security and authentication process of our company's products. The SSO team plays a critical role in managing and optimizing the user authentication experience for both internal and external stakeholders. As part of the team, you'll gain experience in a key area of cybersecurity and user experience, while contributing to real projects that drive the success of the business.


This role is hybrid, based in our Princeton office.


**You Will:**


* Be part of a learning-intensive environment
* Have access to mentorship, guidance, and learning opportunities
* Contribute to important SSO projects
* Get exposure to real-world projects in the field of identity and access systems

**You Have:**


* At least two years completed towards your Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information technology, or a related field.
* Basic understanding of web technologies (HTML, HTTP, SSL) and familiarity with authentication concepts.
* Strong desire to learn about SSO systems, cybersecurity, and identity management.
* Willingness to contribute innovative ideas and work collaboratively in a team environment.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical team members.

\\#LI-Hybrid


Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Non-Union role

We recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company.As a result, we aim for flexibility in structuring competitive compensation offers to ensure we are able to attract the best candidates.The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate's experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.


Pay-for-performance is a key element in our strategy to attract, engage, and motivate talented people to do their best work. Similarly to salary, for bonus eligible roles, targets are set based on a variety of factors including competitive market practice.


For benefits eligible roles, in addition to cash compensation, the company provides a comprehensive and highly competitive benefits package, with a variety of physical health, retirement and savings, caregiving, emotional wellbeing, transportation, and other benefits, including "elective" benefits employees may select to best fit the needs and personal situations of our diverse workforce..


Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.


This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

title: Sales Representative- Off Premise
description:
**Gallo Privacy Policy**

**Why Gallo?**


With a global portfolio of over 100 unique wine and spirits brands, we are the largest family-owned winery in the world. Apply Today! **Our Brands. Your Future.**

**Mercer, Mammoth and Middlesex Territory**

  

Come join our dynamic Sales team at Gallo, where your self-confidence, enthusiasm, product knowledge, creativity, and common sense will shine as you represent our diverse range of distributor products to retail establishments. We are seeking a passionate and driven individual to manage an assigned territory, ensuring optimal sales volume through strategic planning and effective relationship-building with retail decision-makers.

  

In this role, you will conduct tastings at customer locations, pre-plan calls using business builders and trackers, and gain insights into competitive sales trends and pricing. You will utilize your entrepreneurial spirit to achieve 100% distribution in every account, listening carefully to the needs and preferences of retail decision-makers. Your ability to use data, facts, and figures to make persuasive sales presentations, overcome objections, and guide merchandisers will be key to your success.

  

You will manage accounts with conscientious service, ensuring accurate inventory, rotating display products, and maintaining up-to-date records. Proficiency with pocket PCs for order storage and sales reporting is essential. You will also provide management with accurate daily sales reports and display trackings, complying with all distributor policies and procedures.

  

Our ideal candidate holds a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in sales, is over 21 years of age, and has a valid driver’s license with a safe driving record. You should be prepared to travel by automobile, work weekends for special events, and lift cases of product weighing up to 60 pounds. Experience in retail or wine sales, teamwork, leadership, and effective communication will set you apart.


We offer a competitive salary of $55,000 annually in commission and incentives, along with a comprehensive benefits package. Gallo is committed to creating an inclusive work environment and providing reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Apply now to join our team and make a significant impact in the retail industry!

 **What You Will Need:**

* Bachelor's degree; OR Senior class standing at a college or university and a Bachelor's degree is successfully completed and confirmed by the time of hire OR High school diploma or State-issued equivalency certificate plus 4 years of sales experience reflecting increasing levels of responsibility; OR High school diploma or State-issued equivalency certificate plus 1 year of Gallo or affiliated or non-affiliated distributor merchandising or sales experience.
* Must be 21 years of age or older.
* Required to obtain a solicitor's permit as required by state/locality.
* Required to travel by automobile to perform job duties.
* Candidates for this position must have a valid driver’s license and safe driving record.
* Required to obtain a New Jersey driver’s license or appropriate state driver’s license within 30 days of hire.
* Required to lift and move cases of product that weighs up to 60 pounds including lifting overhead.
* Required to work weekends for special functions/events when necessary.
* Required to be 18 years or older. This may be in addition to other age requirements, if applicable, as listed in this job description.

 **What Will Set You Apart:**

* Bachelor’s degree plus 2 years retail sales experience or 2 years wine sales experience.

  

Gallo does not sponsor for employment based visas for this position now or in the future.

* Actual compensation paid within the range will be determined by factors such as the education, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.

title: Part-time Lifeguard
description:
**Berkeley Carroll is a Pre-K through grade 12 college preparatory school of 970 students located in the Park Slope section of Brooklyn in New York City. Our vibrant intellectual community draws students from all over the city. Admission to the school is competitive. Both our parents and students value achievement.**

The Berkeley Carroll School is seeking a Part-time Lifeguard for its Athletic Center swim program. The School’s Athletic Center is open to the community for recreational use during early mornings, evenings, and weekends (September through July). We offer a variety of membership options in addition to group classes for adults and children. Berkeley Carroll is committed to providing educational programs that engage, challenge, and foster fundamental swimming skills.

The lifeguard maintains safe swimming conditions in the pool, on the pool deck and surrounding areas. They will create a safe and positive atmosphere that promotes swimmer safety in accordance with Berkeley Carroll policies and procedures.

* Ensures the safety of all individuals in and around the pool areas.
* Ensures timely opening and closing of pool area according to scheduled hours of operation. Follows opening and closing checklists and procedures.
* Enforce all policies regarding use of pool and pool areas.
* Create a welcoming and safe environment for swimmers
* Maintains effective, positive relationships with other aquatic staff members
* Understands and regularly reviews all emergency procedures and responds to emergency situations immediately and provides emergency care as needed.

title: Client Care Coordinator
description:
**Our mission is to care for our clients, help those in need and direct them to the way of safety.**

**How will you impact your clients’ lives?**

* You’ll be using your expertise to help your clients set their mental health goals, for example, getting housing, going back to school, finding a primary care doctor, etc.
* You’ll engage in care activities to empower your clients to help them achieve their goals.
* Applying your tech guru skills, you’ll collect and enter data into our case management systems, such as Relevant, so we can keep track of clients’ progress.
* You’ll fight for your client's rights! As an advocate for your client, you will be the voice on their side in the battles they can not fight alone. Whether it is working with The Department of Social Services to figure out how to handle their rent-arrears or even asking landlords to extend a client’s lease.

**Who are we looking for?**

We are looking for a ***STAR*** coordinator!

**S - Solution Orientated**

We know all cases are different. Not every client’s best solution will fall into “the way things have always been done”. We want you to be creative and champion new ways of thinking**.**

**T - Tenacious**

Tenacity and passion are needed for this work along with the ability to balance objectivity with empathy. We love to help our clients but not every case will be easy. The only true measure of success is positive outcomes for our clients. Each victory, whether big or small, is a victory to be celebrated!

**A - Above & Beyond**

Each client may bring something different on any given day that may make you step outside of your traditional role. Care Coordinators should be arriving each day with an open mind and be ready to do whatever they can for their client's best interests.

**R - Responsible**

We want to trust that you can manage your caseload like your own agency by making proper decisions for clients’ but when in doubt always seek help. With this work, you are offered a great deal of independence therefore accountability is a must.

**What will CHOICE offer you?**

* A choice of working in four different Westchester locations: White Plains, New Rochelle, Peekskill and the Bronx.
* Medical, dental, vision, and a Flexible Spending Account/Health Reimbursement Account
* Paid parking for all employees
* Life Insurance at $50,000 regardless of your position or hours worked.
* Long term disability
* 401K policy with a company match
* Tuition reimbursement
* Promotions - 85%-90% of our Client Care Supervisors and Program Directors were promoted from within
* A new and exciting mentorship program
* A hybrid work environment - you’ll be working some days in the office and some days in the field. This is done to ensure the safety of our employees and clients due to COVID-19.
* A work schedule of Mon-Fri, 9 am - 5 pm
* Salary range 36.000$ to 39.000$ annually plus the benefits package.
* Hands-on experience in the field

**Who we are?**

CHOICE is an agency that takes pride in providing case management and advocacy services for our clients with mental health or physical health illnesses. Our resources are always expanding to help as many clients as we can such as our budding Re-Entry Program in the Bronx and our partnerships in Poughkeepsie and Rockland County. We are constantly reinventing ourselves to fit the needs of our clients and our employees.

We offer a friendly and fun work environment with plenty of opportunities to connect with your peers and grow as a mental health professional. We pride ourselves in partnering in transformation and changing lives.

**If you are looking for a meaningful connection, this may be the opportunity for you!**

title: Experienced Professional, Project Accounting
description:
This Opportunity


Experienced project accountant professional providing accounting and financial specialist support to one or more Project Managers and/or project team(s). Tasks include reviewing and evaluating project charges for accuracy, completing cost transfers, establishing and updating funding as needed, instituting and maintaining project budgets, and ensuring that all project data is current for medium-sized and/or moderate-level complexity projects. Generates accurate and thorough financial documentation and reporting regarding infrastructure/transportation/professional services projects, working in tandem with project managers on pre-billing information review, cost estimates, and invoicing. Ensures that responsibilities are delivered and adhered to with a level of quality that meets or exceeds acceptable industry standards, supporting the delivery of future-ready solutions to clients.


Your Impact


* For assigned project(s), manage and analyze the collection, recording, and allocating of project costs and revenue, ensuring accurate project profit and loss calculations, and communicating project financial performance and profitability to project/program management.
* Responsible for lifecycle project accounting from creating project accounts in Oracle, to tracking projects and project budget, validating invoicing, project close-out, and reconciling overall project payables and receivables to project budgets.
* Perform detailed and involved accounting tasks related to managing project contract, billing events and billing transaction exceptions revenue for medium-sized and/or moderate-level complex projects.
* Partner with the Project Manager and project team to establish the project budget, updating budgets, and making project accounting recommendations as needed when contract modifications or budget changes arise.
* Generate project financial reports, evaluating the reports for any items, including labor breakage, that need to be escalated for review by the Project Manager as necessary.
* Authorize access to project accounts, and the transfer of expenses into and out of project-related accounts in compliance with established accounting practices and guidelines.
* Maintain quality control standards and procedures for generating accurate and precise project-related financial records using Oracle, spreadsheets, and software.
* For assigned projects, apply learned accounting expertise relating to project resources, labor and expenses, investigating project variances and submitting variance reports to management.
* Verify contract and change order characteristics for projects that are medium-sized and/or of a moderate-level of complexity, including reading and interpreting contract language, method of compensation, modifications, purchase orders, and subcontract/consultant terms.
* Monitor key indicators for managing and analyzing problem projects, keeping project managers and/or project accounting manager informed on any noted concerns.
* Responsible for ensuring draft invoices from billing are accurate based on the contract requirements agreed upon with the client; identifying any needed corrections, obtains Project Manager documentation and signature. Finalizes the invoice approval with the Project Manager/billing team and submits the invoice to the client.
* Subcontract management and coordination with Contract Administrators. This includes evaluating subconsultant invoice submittals for accuracy, establish and maintain purchase orders for subconsultants, and requests and follows up on subcontractor payment requests with Accounts Payable.
* Identify and record unpaid contract billings, following up on any delinquent accounts receivable and/or unbilled costs.
* Respond to requests for more detail from clients, investigate all project expenses not billed to clients, and review and approve all project-related billings to clients.
* Attend project-related meetings to inform the team regarding the current status of project financials, articulating problem projects and following up on any identified actions as discussed.
* Create and submit government reports related to projects.
* Compile information for review by a more Senior Consultant prior to submitting for internal and external auditors as required.
* Interact with regulatory agencies, subcontractors, and clients in a confident and professional manner.
* Remain current in latest project accounting principles and subject matter.
* Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct, and adhere to WSP’s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures.
* Perform additional responsibilities as required by business needs.

Who You Are


**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business, or closely-related discipline (or demonstrated proven equivalent experience).
* 3 to 5 years of relevant post education experience in accounting, project contracts and change management documents.
* Working knowledge of project accounting principles, practices, and methods and their application to project work-related issues.
* Analytical mindset with an ability to exercise sound independent judgement in evaluating situations and making decisions with financial implications to the company.
* Ability to initiate and coordinate efforts with various stakeholders around contract and project requirements.
* Effective/Strong Capable interpersonal and communication skills when interacting with others, expressing ideas effectively and professionally to an accounting and non-accounting audience.
* Effective self-leadership with attention to detail, results orientation, and managing multiple priorities in a dynamic work environment.
* Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, follow instruction, work independently, and comply with company policies.
* Proficiency with technical writing, office automation and accounting software, technology, math principles, spreadsheets, MS Excel, pivot tables, formulas, data format/sort/filter, VLOOKUP, predictive models, and tools.
* Critical thinking and problem-solving skills required to apply learned subject matter and technical knowledge to reach conclusions from data collation, documentation, statistical analysis, and arriving at the most effective, economical, and logical solution.
* Awareness of and adherence to WSP USA’s Project Delivery Handbook.
* Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug/alcohol and harassment policies.
* This is a professional role and as such work deadlines and work hours may extend beyond a typical workday.
Occasional travel may be required depending on project-specific requirements.  
* 

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**

Familiarity with Oracle preferred (but not required).  

*

title: Project Manager, Store Design
description:
We are an American luxury lifestyle brand, founded in 2004. Anchored in the casual elegance of American sportswear, Tory’s design philosophy is defined by effortless silhouettes, innovative materials, eclectic juxtapositions of color, and the tension of past and present. The collections include ready-to-wear, handbags, footwear, accessories, jewelry, home and beauty.
Empowering women is the company’s guiding principle, expressed through Tory’s collections and reflected in the company culture as well as the work of the Tory Burch Foundation. Established in 2009, the Foundation provides women entrepreneurs in the United States with capital, education and community.
You are seeking a work environment where people are encouraged to dream, explore, discover and, as important, laugh together. If you’re prepared to work hard, create impact, and have fun while doing it, we would love to have you join #TeamTory. Apply today!
Life @ToryBurch is Special Because:
When you join us, you’re joining a global, purpose-led company on an exciting growth journey with an amazing culture and great benefits.
Our culture is welcoming and inclusive * - everyone is empowered to make a difference.
* We have the best team in the world and believe in paying competitively and rewarding for high performance.
* Your overall well-being is important to us; we offer generous benefits to help you take care of your mental and physical health, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life.
* We love seeing our employees wear our beautiful collections. You’ll receive a generous employee discount and access to exclusive sample sales.
* We are invested in your professional growth – you’ll have access to free executive coaching on-demand.
* We believe in the importance of giving back and you’ll have many opportunities to do just that through the Tory Burch Foundation and paid volunteer days.


This Role is Tailor-Made for You Because:
You are a critical thinker. You will be a Manager responsible for the store design process from initial design concept through store opening, while maintaining the brand image for Full Price Stores, Off Price Stores and Travel Retail Stores for the International markets. You are the point person for Consultants in order to execute the design per company specifications within set budgets and time frames. Numbers do not scare you! You understand that maintaining budget and adhering to schedule are critical to Store Design/Construction. You enjoy processes, developing standards, as well as problem solving and can think creatively to bring solutions.
A Day in the Life:
The typical day is… atypical. You will be laying out floor plans, coordinating with architects, and reviewing Fit-out shop drawings or prototyping fixtures. You will be maintaining communication with International Partners and cross functional departments (Sales, Visual Merchandising, Store Operations, IT, etc). With your eye for detail, you can visit a job site under construction to ensure consistency with design standards. While every day may not be the same, the consistent thread is that you’ll be working with an amazing team of design project managers who share your passion for excellence.
To Land This Role:* Architecture or interior design degree preferred
* 5+ years of experience in a Project Manager position for retail projects
* Time spent in a traditional design firm and field construction experience are strongly preferred.
* Portfolio of both design and field experience encouraged
* Ability to work strategically with tight deadlines
* Previous experience with International retail projects (a plus but not required)
* Strong communication and follow-up skills
* Excellent proficiency in Autocad, Sketch-up, Photoshop, Microsoft Office is required.
* Highly organized and able to track schedules for multiple projects in various phases
* Must be a team player


Why You'll Want to Join Our Team:
Our Store Design & Construction team is a strategic group of creatives and project managers focused on providing a one-of-a-kind experience for customers from the moment they step inside our boutiques. We do this by building a welcoming store environment, bringing Tory’s vision to life with unique displays and fixtures at every new location and with every renovation. Our work balances the dream with practicality — we care about the aesthetics and the electrical! — and we love taking a blueprint from concept to concrete reality. As we continue to expand our global footprint and scale, we invite you to join us!
How We Work Together* Adaptable – We change before we have to
* Entrepreneurial – We own it
* Collaborative – There’s no “I” in Tory
* Client & Brand Focused – We put ourselves in Tory’s shoes
* Live the Values – We show up for each other
* Functional Expertise – We’re constantly learning and growing


#TeamTory Values
We show up with honesty & kindness, act with integrity & compassion, work with passion & humility and lead with excellence & humor.
Compensation Range
The compensation range for this position is 100,000.00 USD - 125,000.00 USD. Our offer will be based on your relevant experience and work location.
Benefits Information
We offer a generous set of benefits to help you take care of your heath, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life. Here are highlights of key benefits available to all Tory Burch members that work over 30 hours.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Tory Burch LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s age, race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy) or sexual orientation, gender expression, military status, marital status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, disability or membership in any other protected class under applicable law. Likewise, we will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Ordinance No. 184652. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.
Disability Accommodation
Tory Burch is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require assistance or an accommodation with the hiring process, please contact thetalentteam@toryburch.com.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
Are you a proactive and reliable individual looking to join a growing team? Sheba Foods is excited to welcome a Warehouse Associate who will play a crucial role in maintaining the smooth operations of our warehouse. This is a great opportunity for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and enjoys being part of a team that delivers quality African cuisine products to customers across the U.S.
  
  

**About Us:**  

At Sheba Foods, we specialize in bringing authentic African cuisine to the homes and tables of customers nationwide. Our dedication to quality, tradition, and service has made us a leader in African food distribution, and we’re expanding our team to keep up with growing demand.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Efficiently receive and inspect incoming shipments, ensuring accuracy and quality standards are met.
* Pick, pack, and prepare customer orders for shipment, maintaining attention to detail and accuracy.
* Organize and store products in the warehouse, keeping track of inventory levels and ensuring proper stock rotation.
* Operate warehouse equipment such as forklifts and pallet jacks to move and store products safely.
* Assist with inventory management, including cycle counts and stock audits, to ensure accurate records.
* Maintain a clean and organized warehouse environment, adhering to safety and sanitation guidelines.
* Communicate effectively with team members and supervisors to ensure smooth operations.
* Support other departments as needed with shipping, receiving, and special projects.


**Qualifications:**  

* Previous experience in a warehouse or similar role is a plus, but we are willing to train the right candidate.
* Ability to lift and move products weighing up to 50 lbs and perform tasks that require standing, walking, and bending for extended periods.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills to ensure orders are processed accurately.
* Basic computer skills for tracking inventory and shipments.
* A team player with excellent communication skills and a positive attitude.
* Forklift certification or experience is a bonus but not required.
* Willingness to work in a fast-paced, physically demanding environment.


**What We Offer:**  

* Competitive wages with opportunities for growth.
* A positive and inclusive work environment where your contributions are valued.
* Employee discounts on Sheba Foods products.
* Health benefits, paid time off, and holiday pay.
* On-the-job training and opportunities for advancement within the company.


Join the Sheba Foods team and help us continue delivering the rich flavors of African cuisine to customers nationwide. If you’re looking for a rewarding role where you can make a difference, apply today!

description:

In this Sales Representative role, you will work with fellow associates to execute strategic outreach initiatives and facilitate the enrollment process for new customers.

* Serve as the face and voice of our clients' brands within the local community, educating prospective customers on their values and initiatives.

title: Controller / Treasurer
description:
**MolQ Entertainment**

**Controller / Treasurer**

**Job Description**

**Company Overview:** MolQ Entertainment is an American technology company and a media entertainment company launching two global streaming platforms including mQ Films: Top independent films, documentaries, series and original programming and our vMVPD mQ TV: Highly rated and viewed TV networks featuring global news, sports, esports, lifestyle, movie and music networks.

MolQ Entertainment U.S headquarters are located in Stamford, CT and our international headquarters are located in London, United Kingdom.

Our vMVPD mQ TV streaming platform specializes in global news, sports, esports, lifestyle, music and movie TV networks, will launch exclusively in the United States in May 2025, Canada during 3Q 2025 and in the UK during 4Q 2025. Our streaming platform mQ Films has over 1500 hours of high quality, curated film programming, and will launch in the U.K., Ireland and the U.S. during 3Q & 4Q 2025.

MolQ Entertainment will launch our newly produced 24/7 sports network featuring woman sports and international sports and our global news network targeting Gen Z and millennial audiences during 2026.

This is an opportunity to take on a key finance management role in a fast-growing pre-IPO company that involves direct access to the senior management team, department heads and other stakeholders as MolQ Entertainment’s global streaming services mQ Films and mQ TV disrupt the $1 Trillion global streaming media industry.

**About the Position:**

MolQ Entertainment’s Controller/Treasurer will build out and manage global accounting teams located in Stamford, CT and London U.K. In this role, reporting directly to MolQ Entertainment’s Vice President of Finance, you will partner closely with the management team and department heads to help create, implement, and maintain efficient and effective processes around financial reporting, monthly closes, yearly audits, and related items.

Key **Responsibilities:**

· Oversee all corporate accounting and treasury functions.

· Responsible for building and developing accounting and treasury teams.

· Owns general ledger, journal entries, A/R, A/P, payroll, account reconciliations, monthly closes and tax compliance.

· Strong focus on cash flow management and assists with rolling cash forecast.

· Oversees the issuance of financial statements and ensures they are compliant with GAAP.

· Manage inter-company transactions with international business entities.

· Develops, implements and documents companywide financial controllership policies, including T&E guidelines.

· Leads implementation of ERP and T&E systems.

· Collaborates closely with VP of Finance with all internal and external financial reporting and analysis for the management team, department heads, the Board of Directors, and investors.

· Ensures compliance with all local, state, and federal tax filings and regulatory reporting requirements.

· Work on other special projects involving financial reporting, accounting systems, data integrity, general ledger and reporting and optimization, and other compliance issues.

· Promote and provide service excellence through collaborative, informed, accessible and professional engagement.

**Qualifications:**

· Bachelor or Masters Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration

· CPA a must.

· Global accounting experience a plus.

· Subscription/ media / streaming OTT experience preferred.

· International experience preferred.

· Previous experience working for a pre-IPO and/or publicly traded company

· Technical accounting experience

· Ability to find innovative solutions while building scalable accounting processes

· Deep working knowledge of U.S. GAAP and key principles of application for a wide array of finance and accounting areas

· Detail oriented with superior organization skills

· Must have work documentation to work in the U.S.

· Must be able to travel to our London U.K. office

title: Sales Associate
description:
Welcome to Bob’s Discount Furniture, where professionalism meets fun, and every day is an opportunity to shine!

As a Retail Guest Experience Specialist, you’ll be at the forefront of Bob’s success story, helping us maintain our position as a leader in the industry. Our commitment to the "Bob’s Way" means delivering unparalleled customer service without the gimmicks, ensuring each shopper enjoys a transparent and enjoyable shopping journey.

Our founder, Bob Kaufman, said it best: "No phony sales, no phony gimmicks, just everyday low prices and value! We call it the Bob’s Way because no one does it better!"

Here’s what you can expect from us:

* Competitive Hourly Advance/Draw vs. Commission pay structure with bonus potential.
* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage for peace of mind.
* Generous 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan with a company match.
* Paid time off including vacation, sick days, holidays, and yes, even your birthday!
* Employee Assistance Program for additional support when needed.
* Generous employee discount because we believe in making your home as comfortable as your workplace.

Your Responsibilities Will Include:

* Greeting and engaging customers to understand their home furnishing needs and offering tailored solutions.
* Providing world-class customer service, ensuring each shopper enjoys a memorable and satisfying experience.
* Building rapport with clients through exceptional product knowledge and attentive listening skills.
* Developing and maintaining a loyal customer base through effective networking and follow-up.
* Generating sales through a consultative, low-pressure approach that emphasizes value and customer satisfaction.

What We’re Looking For:

* Energetic, self-motivated sales professionals with outstanding interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to network effectively and build strong customer relationships.
* Competitive, goal-oriented individuals who thrive in a team environment.
* Flexibility to work a retail schedule that includes weekends, evenings, and holidays.
* Basic computer skills and strong organizational abilities.

Ready to Take Your Retail Career to New Heights? Join Bob’s Discount Furniture Today!

title: Loader/Unloader
description:
**Advance Your Career as a Loader/Unloader at Truck Jet – Deliver Excellence in Every Shipment**

At Truck Jet, we are revolutionizing logistics with a focus on operational efficiency, safety, and customer satisfaction. We are seeking a dedicated Loader/Unloader to join our dynamic team, ensuring every shipment is handled with precision and care. If you excel in fast-paced environments and are committed to supporting seamless logistics operations, this is your opportunity to make a meaningful impact and grow within a leading company.

**Position Overview:**

As a Loader/Unloader, you will be a vital part of our logistics team. You will manage the safe and efficient loading and unloading of cargo, perform quality checks to ensure accuracy, and maintain warehouse organization. Your attention to detail and commitment to excellence will help guarantee that shipments reach their destinations in perfect condition and on schedule.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Efficient Cargo Handling:** Safely load and unload goods, securing items to prevent damage in transit, while ensuring prompt delivery schedules.
* **Quality Inspections:** Verify cargo against documentation, immediately reporting any discrepancies or damages.
* **Equipment Operation:** Safely and effectively operate forklifts, pallet jacks, and other material-handling equipment.
* **Warehouse Organization:** Keep the warehouse orderly by placing goods in designated areas, supporting a smooth and efficient workflow.
* **Accurate Documentation:** Maintain detailed records of incoming and outgoing shipments to ensure accuracy.
* **Safety Compliance:** Adhere to all safety protocols to maintain a safe, hazard-free working environment.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with team members to meet daily logistics targets and contribute to efficient operations.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** High school diploma or equivalent.
* **Experience:** Previous experience in warehouse, logistics, or similar roles is a plus, but not required—training will be provided.
* **Physical Requirements:** Ability to lift and move heavy items (up to [insert weight]) and remain physically active throughout the shift.
* **Equipment Skills:** Experience with forklifts or pallet jacks is preferred but not mandatory.
* **Detail-Oriented:** Strong attention to detail with a focus on accuracy and safety.
* **Teamwork:** Excellent communication skills and a collaborative attitude.
* **Adaptability:** Ability to perform effectively in a fast-paced, high-energy environment.

**What We Offer:**

* **Competitive Pay:** A salary package that reflects your hard work and dedication.
* **Health & Wellness Benefits:** Comprehensive health insurance, paid time off, and wellness programs to support your well-being.
* **Career Growth Opportunities:** Opportunities for professional development and advancement within our growing logistics operations.
* **Positive Work Environment:** A supportive, safety-oriented culture where each employee is valued and respected.

**Why Choose Truck Jet?**

At Truck Jet, we understand that the quality of our service depends on the strength of our team. As a Loader/Unloader, you will play a direct role in our operational success and in ensuring customer satisfaction. We are committed to fostering a positive, growth-oriented workplace where your contributions are recognized, and your career can thrive.

Join Truck Jet and become an essential part of our journey toward logistics excellence!

title: Regional Operations Manager
description:
Premier Health Associates created a new role to support current operations and growth initiatives in the strategic business partnership with Atlantic Health, Atlantic Health Premier MSO. The Regional Operations Manager leads, supports, and monitors multiple sites in the service region covering Milford, PA, Morris County, Sussex County and Warren County. The Regional Operations Manager ensures assigned sites operate productively, cost-effectively, safely, and respectfully of patients, staff, and providers, and serves as a liaison between practice sites and core business operations.

**Duties and responsibilities include:**

* Oversee daily activities of medical practice sites working in close concert with direct reports.
* Provide project management assistance with startup and merging practices.
* Collaborate with HR to recruit, hire, train and retain staff members.
* Align staffing levels to patient hours and volume at each site.
* Ensure quality registration, charge entry, collection of balances and copays at time of service.
* Oversee clinical services, advise Clinical Manager of issues in clinical area of practice site.
* Maintain excellent patient satisfaction, productivity standards and metrics.
* Ensure assigned practice sites are fully engaged in value-based care.
* Enforce adherence to PHA standards, policies and procedures and compliance with state and federal regulations.
* Provide excellent customer service to practices and serve as practice main point of contact for issue resolution.
* Maintain effective professional working relationships with staff members at all levels.
* Identify with, share in, and display a commitment to the mission and objectives of the organization.
* Participate on committees as assigned.
* Participate in regular professional development.
* Identify with, share in, and display a commitment to the mission and objectives of the organization.
* Travel up to 50%.

**Essential Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree in business or healthcare discipline.
* **Experience:** Minimum of 5 years of multi-site management/leadership experience in physician practice operations. Previous experience with mergers and acquisitions strongly preferred.
* **CMPE/FACMPE** -plus
* **Lean Sigma Certification**-plus

**Knowledge/Skills/Experience:**

* Knowledge of outpatient practice operations, including registration, charge capture, clinical procedures, staffing models and healthcare regulations.
* Solid understanding of HIPAA, OSHA, and other healthcare related regulations.
* Experience recruiting, onboarding, development, and retention of personnel.
* Ability to deliver clear directives and set expectations.
* Experience evaluating workflows and making changes to increase efficiency and quality.
* Detail-oriented and outcome driven.
* Organized, creative, flexible, self-motivated. Excellent follow-up skills.
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact positively with a wide range of constituents.
* Effective oral and written communication
* Proven ability to understand practice goals, services, culture, and strategy.
* Demonstrated excellence in organization, planning, and project management.
* Skilled in record keeping, data collection and systems information.
* Demonstrated ability to execute and monitor new initiatives, provide appropriate feedback and/or corrective actions.
* Ability to function effectively within an ever-changing environment and to meet deadlines and reprioritize as necessary.
* Proficiency in medical software applications, Microsoft Office Suite, payroll applications

**SALARY IS COMMENSURATE WITH EXPERIENCE**

title: Import Specialist
description:
We are an established Custom House Broker and NVOCC that has been in business for 35 years! We offer a complete portfolio of global shipping and logistics services, including door to door freight forwarding and project management. We handle airfreight, LCL, FCL and break bulk. Regardless of cargo type or size, we have the skills and know-how to provide a choice of cost-effective solutions, around the world and around the clock. We have an immediate opening for an Import Specialist for our Edison, NJ office. The position is responsible for the daily movement of our customer's products including working with US Customs and other carriers, vendors to find the best and fastest solution. This includes, but is not limited to, following up with carriers, routing international shipments, negotiating rates, producing quotations, working with our customers and agents to acquire all required import documents, processing delivery orders, creating billing invoices, communicating with overseas agents, problem solving and tracking shipments, all while providing excellent customer service to our clients and foreign partners.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

- 2-3 years of Import experience, preferably with a CHB.

- Custom clearances, and co-ordination of all import activities.

- Knowledge of trucking in order to facilitate best price for client.

- Preferably having knowledge of HTS codes and other departments like FDA, Fish and Wildlife (not a requirement).

- Will work in a team of 9-10 other members so should be a team player, while being able to be responsible for their own workload and files.

- Being able to manage being Detail oriented but in a fast paced environment

- Proficient with computer software, especially word, outlook and excel

- Knowledge of IES-Descartes Custom System (preferable but not required)

title: Design Intern - Womenswear
description:
Are you a movement maker? Are you seeking new and exciting career opportunities?
Here is what you need to know about the job:  

An established private label apparel company specializing in elevated womenswear is seeking a talented and versatile Design Intern with a strong eye for trends, fabrics, and an ability to thrive in a fast-paced, creative environment. Our NYC-based internship offers college students the opportunity to immerse themselves in the world of fashion design, gain hands-on experience, and learn from industry leaders at Li & Fung. We are looking for dedicated, detail-oriented, and creative thinkers willing to engage at every level of the design process. This is a full-time, paid internship in our LF Markets USA division.
Start Date: October 2024  

Hours per week: 40 hours  

Duration: 6 months  

Hourly Rate: $20.00 - $22.00 per hour  

Location: New York, NY
\\* Please note that your portfolio or work samples must be submitted to be considered for the internship. \\*
Roles and Responsibilities:* Conduct in-depth market research on current trends in theme, fabric, wash, trim, and style relevant to womenswear.
* Hand sketch detailed garment designs, showcasing an ability to illustrate intricate details and unique design elements.
* Create flat sketches using Adobe Illustrator and develop tech packs with a fundamental understanding of garment construction.
* Collaborate with designers to create original embroideries, prints, and patterns, utilizing both hand sketches and digital tools like Photoshop and Illustrator.
* Assist in developing seasonal trend reports and presentations for both new and existing clients, tailored to an elevated market.
* Help manage the fabric library, ensuring it is well-organized and up-to-date with the latest fabric samples.
* Maintain an organized design room and showroom to ensure a productive work environment.
* Support designers in daily tasks and projects, including fittings, mood board creation, and sample management.


Skills & Requirements:* Must be a Fashion Design major with a strong interest in elevated womenswear.
* Exceptional hand-sketching skills are required, with the ability to translate ideas into detailed illustrations.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop) and knowledge of 3D software (CLO, Browzwear, etc.) is a plus.
* A strong team player with a passion for design and product development.
* Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and set priorities effectively.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills.
* Strong analytical skills and decision-making capabilities.


Important Notice: Fraudulent Communications: It has come to our attention that there are people posing as representatives of Li & Fung. These imposters may offer false opportunities including fake employment offers and other fraudulent opportunities by email or other means of communication. Please beware of such fraudulent communications. If you are in doubt as to the legitimacy of any communications purportedly from Li & Fung, please verify with us by contacting LFHR@lifung.com.
#lifung
If this sounds like you, Apply Now!  

As an equal opportunity employer, we shall consider all applicants regardless of gender, age, religion, marital status, race, sexual orientation, disability, disease, pregnancy, or trade union and/or political affiliation, and disregard all factors deemed inappropriate by local law and the International Labor Organization’s Declaration on Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work.

title: 2025 Analyst, Global Portfolio Management Co-Op (Jan- June) - University
description:
Description  

Kenvue is currently recruiting for:


**2025 Analyst, Global Portfolio Management Co-Op (Jan - June)**



This position reports to the Global Portfolio Manager.


**Who we are**



At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including Neutrogena, Aveeno, Tylenol, Listerine, Johnson’s and BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent. Our global team is made up of ~ 22,000 diverse and brilliant people, passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact the life of millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours.


**Role reports to:** Global Portfolio Manager


**Location:** Summit, New Jersey (Kenvue’s corporate headquarters is currently located in Skillman NJ, but is scheduled to move to Summit, NJ in or around early 2025)
**Pay:** Anticipated hourly pay for this position is$20.00 – $26.00 will be based on candidate’s program year, discipline and degree/experience  


**What you will do**


The Analyst, Global Portfolio Management Co-op is responsible for Knowledge Management and Training within the Global Project and Portfolio Management space. The analyst will support the development, deployment, and maintenance of communication and reference materials to support organizational change, system and tool adoption, and driving data integrity and compliance.


Key Responsibilities* Develops and deploys change management, communication, and training plans to relevant internal Stakeholders
* Lead the Global Project & Portfolio Management (GPPM) team’s documentation of tacit knowledge and internal processes


* Ownership of GPPM Knowledge Management site, ensuring the site is easy to use and navigate and all content is relevant to current business processes and system rules


* Develop core GPPM training curriculum for internal stakeholders
* Establish standard framework of knowledge management offerings for GPPM reporting publications


* Support Global Portfolio & Project Management team in documenting and presenting key internal processes in an engaging and effective way for stakeholders


* Continually look for opportunities to improve training material, user experience and data quality in the PPM space


* Any other responsibilities as needed

Qualifications **What we are looking for**


Required Qualifications
* Candidate must be actively enrolled pursuing a Bachelors degree and be at least a sophomore
* Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. and must not require sponsorship for employment visa status now or in the future (e.g. H1-B status)


* Candidate must be able to work full time (40 hours per week) during the duration of the co-op position. Role anticipated to be Jan 2025 – June 2025.
* Ability to work onsite at posted location

Desired Qualifications
* Preferred Supply Chain Management or related majors (such as Economics, Finance, Business Administration, Engineering, etc.)


* A minimum GPA of 3.0 Cumulative is strongly preferred


* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (experience with V-Lookups, Pivot tables, etc…)


* Collaboration and team building skills; proven leadership ability


* Analytical mindset and data analysis skills


* Ability to manage multiple projects and initiatives while maintaining a strong sense of urgency


* Must be a self-starter with ability to work independently within a matrix environment where tight timelines exist


* Willingness to investigate, solve, and leverage data to develop recommendations.


* Ability to identify and implement process improvements.


* Dependable and reliable

  


**What’s in it for you**
* Learning & Development Opportunities


* Gain insight into what it’s really like to be an employee at a large CPG organization with valuable networking opportunities with full time employees and fellow co-ops


* A deep understanding of Kenvue culture and career possibilities


* Tools to deliver meaningful projects and improve upon both your technical and soft skills

  



Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

  




Primary Location NA-US-New Jersey-Skillman

title: Maintenance Apprentice - Prism
description:

**How We Deliver A Winning Performance:**

**What You’ll Be Doing:**  



As a Maintenance Technician Apprentice, you will train with our property management team to learn essential skills in property maintenance, including HVAC, plumbing, appliances, and electrical work. Over 14 weeks, you'll receive hands-on training and classroom instruction, guided by experienced team members. Successful completion of the program leads to promotion to Maintenance Technician.


* Partner with assigned service team members for on the job training
* **Observe, learn, and understand a wide range of maintenance skills and processes**
* Learn to operate light equipment for basic repairs under the guidance of skilled technical staff
* Demonstrate skills and processes by working independently or with a team as training progresses
* Perform maintenance tasks to gain hands-on experience and showcase proficiency
* Learn relevant computer software applications used by the service team
**What You’ll Need To Thrive:**

* General ability to demonstrate mechanical aptitude
* High School diploma or equivalent
* Valid driver’s license and good driving record along with auto insurance will be required when working between multiple sites that require driving throughout the day. If you do not possess a valid driver’s license, you will be required to sign an addendum agreeing not to drive any form of registered motorized vehicle while at work/on the clock.
* Computer literacy, and must be able to effectively communicate both orally and in writing in English for all work-related purposes
* Availability to work a flexible schedule, including weekends
* Upon successful promotion to Maintenance Technician, must be able to respond to emergencies after normal business hours and on weekends when assigned on-call responsibilities; a telephone number where you can be reached after-hours must be provided to your manager
* Service team employees, with limited exceptions, are required to use their own smartphone to perform certain aspects of their job
**Salary** : $23.90/ Hour


**Bonus Qualifications:**

* Trade school certification/diploma
* EPA Section 608 Type I, Type II or Universal certification
* Residential or commercial property management, hospitality, or retail experience

The amount of the discount offered is determined based on the market, ranging upwards from 20%. Learn more about our Total Wellbeing program here.

title: Community Maintenance Director - Portside Towers
description:
At Equity Residential, we're dedicated to creating thriving communities, and we invite you to be part of our team. Embracing values like Diversity, Sustainability, and Total Wellbeing, we foster a workplace culture of authenticity and collaboration.


**How We Deliver A Winning Performance:**

* Question Authority
* Walk the Talk
* Share Knowledge
* Listen, not just Hear
* See the Glass Half Full
* Take Educated Risks
* Enjoy the Ride
* Share the Spotlight
* Do the Right Thing
* Test Your Limits

**We Care About Your Total Wellbeing:**

* Physical Wellbeing: Medical, dental, and vision care
* Social Wellbeing: 9 paid holidays, annual vacation time, paid sick leave, new parent benefits
* Financial Wellbeing: 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, Rent Discounts, Competitive Compensation
* Community Wellbeing: Paid Community Service Hours
* Career Wellbeing: Leadership Development
* Learn more about our Total Wellbeing program here.

**What You'll Be Doing:**

Our Community Service Directors are a key part of each community’s success, responsible for overseeing our most challenging, complex assets (top NOI drivers, mixed-use, and/or multi-site). They are our service leaders who provide the technical know-how behind each apartment community and provide guidance and training to the maintenance team.


* Leading and supervising your team in managing service requests, delegating tasks, and directing department work
* Collaborating on property objectives through recruitment, hiring, training, and motivation of a high-performing staff
* Ensuring team adherence to Equity standards, promptly handling resident service requests, and ensuring safe tool and equipment usage
* Analyzing property management data, providing financial recommendations, and contributing to annual budget preparation
* Monitoring service contracts, vendors, and capital improvement projects, suggesting operational improvements
* Conducting regular community inspections, recommending repairs, and preparing status reports
* Overseeing mechanical equipment, pool operations, and safety compliance while assisting the team in various maintenance tasks

**What You’ll Need To Thrive:**

* Hands-on maintenance experience in areas including, but not limited to plumbing, electrical, appliance, and HVAC is necessary.
* 3 or more years of Residential or commercial property management, hospitality, or retail experience
* Managerial experience
* High School diploma or equivalent
* Valid driver’s license and good driving record along with auto insurance will be required when working between multiple sites that require driving throughout the day. If you do not possess a valid driver’s license, you will be required to sign an addendum agreeing not to drive any form of registered motorized vehicle while at work/on the clock.
* Computer literacy, and must be able to effectively communicate both orally and in writing in English for all work-related purposes
* Knowledge of federal and state apartment housing laws
* Availability to work a flexible schedule, including weekends
* Must be able to respond to emergencies after normal business hours and on weekends when assigned on-call responsibilities; a telephone number where you can be reached after-hours must be provided to your manager
* Service team employees, with limited exceptions, are required to use their own smartphone to perform certain aspects of their job
* EPA Section 608 Type I and Type II or Universal certification must be obtained within 90
* days of hire if required based on the needs of the community

**Salary:** $97,410 - $108,233/ Year


*The successful candidate's starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, and qualifications.*

**Bonus Qualifications**

* Management of complex communities or multi-site experience
