title: Quality Manager
description:
highly engineered niche products for the aerospace, military, and medical markets from our modern facility in Southwestern Connecticut**.** Our recent success has provided the foundation for further growth and diversification. We are in the process of reaching for our next level of achievement based on the talents of our employees in product innovation, product quality and customer service. Each of these fundamental capabilities provides client our competitive advantage. This position is responsible for making sure products meet quality standards. This position develops, implements, and manages quality control systems designed to ensure continuous production consistent with established standards, customer specifications and production. Successful applicants will be driven to excel as part of a highly capable, high performance team. We value commitment, passion and out of the box creativity. The successful individual will be part of a close-knit group with full exposure and involvement in all aspects of the company.

**Key Responsibilities** 

* Manage Client Engineering’s Quality Department.
* Maintain Client Engineering’s Quality System.
* Ensure that all products meet Client Engineering’s Quality Standards.
* Maintain sub-contractors Quality Ratings.
* Member of the ISO Management Team.
* FAA Repair Station Repairman.
* Support ISO and AS9100 audits.
* Support customer audits.
* Conduct one-to-one reviews and performance Reviews.

**Job Requirements and Qualifications**

**Education**:

· Bachelor’s Degree or 5 years relevant experience.

**Experience:**

· 5 years minimum experience as a QC inspector or part of a quality department with Supervisory/Management experience.

**Personal Specification/Essential Qualities**

· Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite of products.

· Effective communication skills with ability to work in a strong team environment.

· General understanding of Quality Management System requirements inclusive of ISO 9001:2008 and/or AS9100 Standards.

· Great people skills. Will be interacting with all levels of the organization on an everyday basis.

· Organizational Skills.

· Problem Solving/Analytical.

· Customer/Client Focus.

· Time and performance Management.

· Collaboration.

· Leadership.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $113,126.00 - $118,366.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Ability to Relocate:

* Stamford, CT: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner
description:
\\*Job Summary\\* We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing high-quality mental health care to patients, focusing on assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of psychiatric disorders. This role requires a strong understanding of behavioral health and the ability to work collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team to ensure comprehensive patient care. \\*Responsibilities\\* - Conduct thorough psychiatric evaluations and assessments of patients. - Develop and implement individualized treatment plans based on patient needs. - Provide psychotherapy and medication management for patients with mental health conditions. - Monitor patient progress and adjust treatment plans as necessary. - Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to coordinate care and ensure comprehensive treatment. - Educate patients and their families about mental health conditions and treatment options. - Maintain accurate and timely documentation of patient encounters in compliance with regulatory standards. - Stay informed about current best practices in psychiatric care, including acute pain management, infection control, and senior care. \\*Requirements\\* - Master’s degree in Nursing with a specialization in Psychiatric/Mental Health Nursing. - Current state licensure as a Nurse Practitioner. - Experience in behavioral health settings preferred. - Knowledge of workers compensation law is a plus. - Skills in physical examinations, suture techniques, and cardiac catheterization are desirable. - Ability to lift patients as required for assessments or interventions. - Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport with patients from diverse backgrounds. - Commitment to ongoing professional development and staying current with advancements in psychiatric nursing practices. Join us in making a difference in the lives of our patients through compassionate and effective mental health care.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $100.00 - $150.00 per hour

Medical Specialty:

* Psychiatry

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

Work Location: In person

title: Separation Science Co op
description:
Syensqo is all about chemistry. We’re not just referring to chemical reactions here, but also to the magic that occurs when the brightest minds get to work together. This is where our true strength lies. In you. In your future colleagues and in all your differences. And of course, in your ideas to improve lives while preserving our planet’s beauty for the generations to come.

  


**We are looking for:**  

This co-op position includes responsibility for carrying out analyses on various samples for research and customer driven projects in both the Polymer Additives and Mining business lines. The position will focus on analytical techniques in Separation science. Separations based analyses: The co-op will work with experienced separation group members to execute identification and/or quantitation of molecules in complex mixtures. Examples include quantitation of additive mixtures in polyolefins, as well as identification of the major reaction products versus the impurities during the synthesis process. The co-op will learn and then perform analyses using liquid and gas chromatography (LC and GC) with a variety of detectors including UV-Vis, CAD and Mass Spectrometry.  

The co-op will write well-documented reports and communicate clearly with project teams and scientists. The role will require extensive interactions with research and development, process development, plants, technical services and other members of the analytical department.

**We count on you for:**

* The analyst will provide chromatography analysis of small molecules and polymers.
* Techniques include: liquid chromatography (LC), ultra-high pressure LC (UPLC), gas chromatography (GC), LC/GC combined with high-resolution mass spectrometry (MS).
* Effective oral and written communication skills. Document work in electronic notebooks, reports and communicate with customers and colleagues.
* Results should be well-organized, written and communicated clearly in a timely manner with project teams and scientists.
* Manage daily laboratory activities including instrument maintenance, housekeeping and chemical waste.
* Understand and follow key Syensqo safety policies and procedures for the site, including but not limited to the following:
* Emergency Response / Evacuation Guidelines
* Visitor Safety Policy
* Housekeeping – 5S organization of laboratories
* Demonstrate a commitment to safety
* Attend monthly safety training
* Know the location of first aid and emergency response equipment, chemicals, and chemical documentation.
Obtain equipment or process specific safety training as necessary according to the specific hazards  
* 

**You can count on us for:**

* Long-lasting excellent customer relations, self-dependent working, and a variety of tasks in one of the world’s leading chemical companies.
* Excellent training & development possibilities. (Value for the candidate, growth and learning opportunities)

  

  

**You will bring:**

* A current BS student in Analytical Chemistry or related discipline (Chemistry, Biology, Chemical Engineering or Forensic Science, etc).
* Prior experience in analytical techniques is preferred but not necessary.
* The abilities to work well in technical workgroups, write well-documented reports, and communicate clearly are required.
* We expect that the successful candidate will thrive in a dynamic team environment.

This position requires a high level of creativity, analytical skills, and independent work.  
* 

**You will get:**

* Hands on experience
* Competitive hourly pay


About us

* Syensqo is a science company developing groundbreaking solutions that enhance the way we live, work, travel and play. Inspired by the scientific councils which Ernest Solvay initiated in 1911, we bring great minds together to push the limits of science and innovation for the benefit of our customers, with a diverse, global team of more than 13,000 associates. Our solutions contribute to safer, cleaner, and more sustainable products found in homes, food and consumer goods, planes, cars, batteries, smart devices and health care applications. Our innovation power enables us to deliver on the ambition of a circular economy and explore breakthrough technologies that advance humanity.
* At Syensqo, we seek to promote unity and not uniformity. We value the diversity that individuals bring and we invite you to consider a future with us, regardless of background, age, gender, national origin, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, ability or identity. We encourage individuals who may require any assistance or accommodations to let us know to ensure a seamless application experience. We are here to support you throughout the application journey and want to ensure all candidates are treated equally. If you are unsure whether you meet all the criteria or qualifications listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

As you may already know, Syensqo is the newly established standalone company resulting from the recent spin-off of Solvay. While both organizations are in the process of finalizing the transition, some email communications related to your recruitment process may continue to come from Solvay.  
* 

#Internship


#LI-onsite


#LI-DR1
company_description: Syensqo: Driving breakthroughs that advance humanity!

title: Dishwasher
description:
**Work With Purpose**

  

At Five Star Senior Living, our people are the critical link to those we serve, and it is their vitality, energy, and caring nature that allows us to fulfill our mission of enriching and inspiring the journey of life. In addition to nurturing and advancing the lives of our residents, our team members enjoy meaningful opportunities for personal and professional growth, within a supportive culture centered around advancing *their* lives, as well.

**The Opportunity**

We are actively seeking a Dishwasher add to our team. As Dishwasher you will be responsible for cleaning dishes in a food service environment to ensure that the kitchen and community has a steady supply of clean plates, bowls, silverware, pots, pans, and glasses. Your duties will include prioritizing loads of different types of kitchenware, hand-washing dishes, loading the dishwasher and placing dishes to dry.

**What You’ll Do**

**Organize**

* Washes and inspects all dishware and glassware.
* Stores clean utensils, dishes and glassware in proper places.
* Keeps dish washing machine and dish room in clean operating condition.
* Promptly reports any malfunctions or breakdowns of equipment to Food Service Manager Sweeps and mops kitchen area and waitstaff station and cleans filter over stove area.
* Delivers ice to dining room. May assist waitstaff with serving and bringing in dishes to kitchen, when necessary. May deliver meals to residents in their apartments, when necessary.
* Performs assigned cleaning assignments according to established policies and utilizes the proper cleaning chemicals.
* Keeps work areas clean and uncluttered.
* Ensures that dishes are readily available for the next meal.
* Stores dishes in the proper location in a way to prevent contamination

**What You’ll Bring**

**Experience & Education**

* High School diploma or general education degree (GED).
* Ability to communicate effectively to fulfill position responsibilities.
* Able to read schedules, menus and position related instructions.
* Ability to work in a team environment, work flexible shifts and communicate effectively with coworkers.
* The following equipment is used, including, but not limited to, dishwasher, mop sponge, dish scrubber and cleaning chemicals.

**We Got You**

  

We see and support the whole you. Because investing in you, and all our team members, is the first step in making a difference in the lives of others.

* Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Vision
* 401k + Match
* Competitive PTO
* Life, Disability & other supplemental benefits
* Professional Development Funds
* Wellness Coaching & Personal Support Benefits
* Recognition & Reward Programs

**Is This You?**

  

Beyond checking off the boxes, we’re looking for someone who shares our deep sense of purpose and passion for advancing the lives of others.

* **Puts People First** – You have an authentic connection to our vision of a world in which the quality of life is ageless, and a desire to advance our culture by always respecting and empowering our team members, residents, and families.
* **Customer Focused** – You strive to build and strengthen customer loyalty by delivering exceptional hospitality, thoughtful solutions, and innovative customer attraction and retention strategies.
* **Results Oriented** – You’re forward thinking, seeing the big picture as you lead with empathy and drive to exceed results. You firmly believe that the way in which we achieve results is just as important as what we accomplish together.
* **Drives Operational Excellence** – You encourage a mindset of continuous improvement. You respect ideas, collaborate, and empower others to elevate how and what we deliver for our customers and each other.
* **Embraces Change** – You’re a change driver! A positive communicator who engages all key stakeholders to help them anticipate and embrace what’s next, you’re always adjusting the target for continuous improvement.

**EEOC**

  

Five Star prohibits discrimination against any applicant or employee with regard to or on the basis of race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, age, ancestry, sex, pregnancy (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity and expression (including transgender), sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, military status, certain criminal records, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), HIV testing, a personal admission to a facility for the care and treatment of a mentally ill person and taking of parental leave or membership in any other category protected by applicable law. In addition to federal requirements, Five Star complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has communities and/or facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.


In addition, Five Star expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, age, ancestry, sex, pregnancy (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity and expression (including transgender), sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, military status, certain criminal records, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), HIV testing, a personal admission to a facility for the care and treatment of a mentally ill person and taking of parental leave or membership in any other category protected by applicable law. We will not tolerate harassment of employees in the workplace, or in other settings in which employees may find themselves in connection with their employment. Improper interference with the ability of Five Star’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge. Additionally, retaliation, including intimidation, threats, or coercion, because an employee or applicant has objected to discrimination harassment or retaliation, engaged or may engage in filing a complaint, assisted in a review, investigation, or hearing or have otherwise sought to obtain their legal rights under any federal, state, or local law is prohibited and will not be tolerated.

title: SHSAT Tutor
description:
\\*Job Overview\\*

We are seeking a dedicated and passionate Tutor to join our educational team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SHSAT, particularly in Math and English, and possess the ability to create engaging lesson plans tailored to individual student needs. This role requires effective classroom management skills and a commitment to fostering a positive learning environment. The Tutor will work with students of all ages, including adults, and may also assist in curriculum development and the integration of learning technology.

\\*Responsibilities\\*

- Develop and implement customized lesson plans that cater to the diverse learning styles of students.

- Provide one-on-one or small group tutoring sessions in subjects such as Math and other academic areas.

- Utilize effective classroom management techniques to maintain an engaging and productive learning atmosphere.

- Assess student progress regularly and adjust teaching strategies accordingly to ensure comprehension and retention of material.

- Collaborate with parents, educators, and other stakeholders to support student learning objectives.

- Incorporate technology into lessons to enhance the educational experience and facilitate remote learning when necessary.

- Support students with special education needs by adapting materials and teaching methods as required.

- Document student progress and provide feedback on their performance.

\\*Experience\\*

- Proven experience in tutoring or teaching, preferably in a formal educational setting.

- Familiarity with curriculum development and lesson planning is highly desirable.

- Strong knowledge of classroom management techniques that promote a positive learning environment.

- Experience working with special education students is a plus.

- Proficiency in using learning technology tools to enhance instruction is beneficial.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential for effectively educating students and collaborating with parents and colleagues.

We encourage individuals who are passionate about education and committed to making a difference in students' lives to apply for this rewarding opportunity as a Tutor.

title: Sales Executive
description:
**About the role:** We are seeking a high-value Solar Sales Executive to drive sales and revenue in the Westchester County Market. This is a highly visible role that requires sound sales ability, as well as the ability to manage a pipeline of prospective customers. In this fast-paced role, you will be actively working 15-25 pre-qualified opportunities per month, while maintaining a pipeline of prospective customers.

**About the company:** Harvest Power is a nationally recognized leader in the solar energy industry, providing full service residential and commercial solar energy project management including design, engineering, and installation of solar energy systems.

**Responsibilities:**

* Generates revenue through winning residential solar contracts
* Conducts 2-4 discovery consultations per day to gather information and ascertain prospective customers’ needs
* Relays prospective customers’ needs to design & finance team to ensure optimal solution is delivered
* Conducts 2-4 proposal presentations per day detailing customers’ solar designs, costs, & projected savings on future electric costs
* Closes 6-10 contracts per month yielding $250-450k in gross revenues
* Continuous outreach to existing pipeline of prospective customers
* Negotiates with prospective customers on competitive bids, pricing, and product offerings
* Consults with & qualifies prospective customers for finance products
* Ensures agreements and finance documents are fully executed
* Collaborates with Business Development Representatives to ensure discovery consultations are well-qualified and strategically booked
* Reports to Director on market trends
* Monitors projects’ progress to ensure timeliness
* Works with Sales Director on special projects as required
* Develops & masters professional sales competencies

**Qualifications and Skills:**

* Demonstrated success in an Outside Sales, Account Executive, or relevant role
* 3 years of previous sales experience, or a very strong work ethic
* Ability to present complex proposals that include financing terms
* Ability to work a long & flexible schedule to achieve sales targets (50+ hours per week)
* Ability to work nights and weekends
* Ability to use cloud-based software Salesforce, Microsoft Office Suite and troubleshoot through basic computer/technology issues
* Excellent face to face and phone communication skills
* Excellent written communication skills (proper grammar & email etiquette)
* Professional organizational competencies (detail-oriented, prepared, punctual)
* Ideally a long-term employee who wants to grow in the organization

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* First Year OTE is $100k-125k
* Higher performers are on pace to earn $175k-275k
* Commissions
* PTO, Health, Dental & Vision Package
* Career opportunities for high-value employees

**EOE**

title: Care Coordinator
description:
Premier Health Associates is Sussex County’s largest provider of health care in the region.

Overview:  
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Medical Assistant (with Clinical Experience) or LPN to join our team as a Chronic Care Coordinator. Premier Health offers applicable in office training.

As a Care Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in providing support and coordinating care for our patients. This is an excellent opportunity for someone with clinical experience and a passion for helping others.

Duties:  
- Call clients monthly, coordinate patient care, maintain BP logs and monitor maintenance, develop and execute care plans to counsel and effectuate positive health and wellness goals.  
- Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records, including medical history, treatment and care plans  
- Answer phone calls and respond to inquiries from patients, providers, and other healthcare professionals  
- Coordinate referrals to specialists and follow up on patient care  
- Collaborate with the healthcare team to ensure continuity of care for patients along the healthcare continuum.  
- Provide general administrative support, including filing, data entry, and correspondence

Skills:  
- Proficiency in office software applications (e.g., Microsoft Office Suite) and EMR applications  
- Knowledge of medical terminology and procedures  
- Experience working in a medical office setting preferred  
- Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively  
- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written  
- Attention to detail and accuracy in record keeping

We offer competitive compensation based on experience and qualifications. This is a full-time non-patient facing position with flexible hours.

If you are passionate about providing exceptional patient care and have the skills necessary to excel in this role, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience. We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Assistant General Manager
description:
**Chef Marc Forgione, and Respect Hospitality are looking for an Assistant General Manager at Peasant.**  

  

Chef Marc currently has three restaurants as a part of this group, his namesake property in TriBeca as well as Peasant & Trotteria One Fifth.


The Assistant General Manager of the restaurant directs and oversees all operations in accordance with standardized policies to ensure the restaurant runs smoothly daily, best practices are in place to drive revenue and profitability and acts as the leader to drive the culture and morale of the team.

**ASSISTANT GENERAL MANAGER RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

The essential functions include, but are not limited to the following and may change or be  

adjusted at any time:  

* Work with the General Manager of the property to set the direction of the business in day to day operations as well as develop and


execute a plan to drive sales, manage costs, and grow the business  

* Manages FOH schedule; ensures the FOH is properly staffed and in line with labor cost goals
* Handles all FOH staff responsibilities in partnership with General Manager and HR (includes:


onboarding, training and development, employee relations, disciplinary action, documentation, terminations, etc.)  

* Shares all repair and maintenance responsibilities for the restaurant with the General Manager and Executive Chef
* Works directly with General Manager in order to promote a strong and unified leadership dynamic—breaking barriers of separation between FOH and BOH
* Oversees and manages the dining room management team, ensuring that they are performing up to standard and supporting the needs of the restaurant in their given roles
* Responsible for being a part of pre-shift meetings
* Works with entire leadership team to drive the success of the restaurant
* Oversees organization, efficiency and policies pertaining to service in the dining room
* Balances administrative responsibilities with service responsibilities
* Enhances and strengthens guest relationships, established and new
* Promotes cooperative effort, a team spirit, good morale and positive culture among employees
* Resolves complaints from guests in a polite, friendly manner always making sure we follow up with them when needed
* Ensures the entire space looks, smells, and feels great (lighting, temperature, bathrooms, cleanliness, and seating arrangements)
* Participates in training about standardized policies (HR, fire, hygiene, health, safety, employee handbook, etc.)
* Helps with duties of other employees (i.e. server, food runner, etc.) as needed
* Responsible for ensuring that all server check outs and restaurant closing duties are performed daily to standards, delegating this responsibility when appropriate
* Has a strong understanding of company background, core values and philosophy
* Adheres to all company safety and sanitation policies and procedures
* Performs other work-related duties as assigned

ASSISTANT GENERAL MANAGER QUALIFICATIONS:  

* Minimum 2 years working in a high-touch restaurant environment and has worked through a restaurant opening previously
* Previous management experience required
* Experience with operations management, team management, and team development
* Proficient in a variety of technology systems, especially Microsoft Office, Microsoft Excel, and business costing analysis
* Able to work nights, weekends and holidays, and variable schedule, per the needs of the business
* NYC Food Protection Certificate
* Willingness to maintain a clean, healthy, and safe working environment
* Ability to coordinate multiple activities with attention to detail
* Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision

RESTAURANT GENERAL MANAGER PHYSICAL DEMANDS:  

* Ability to be flexible with job demands and open minded when being asked to complete tasks
* Ability to operate and use all equipment necessary to run the restaurant
* Ability to handle stress under pressure
* Ability to move or handle equipment throughout the restaurant generally weighing 0-50 pounds
* Ability to work varied hours/days as business dictates
* Ability to stand for up to 8-10 hours a day

Compensation Details


Compensation: Salary ($75-$95)


Benefits & Perks: Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Paid Time Off, Commuter Benefits, Potential Bonuses, Dining Discounts


We are an equal opportunity employer; we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.


More detail about Peasant part of Respect Hospitality

title: Floor Manager
description:
**ABOUT US:**  

Highly-acclaimed Wine Spectator Grand Award-Winning Ai Fiori is looking for an energetic, professional, and passionate Restaurant Dining Room Manager to join the team. Ai Fiori operates as part of Altamarea Group, an award-winning global hospitality firm with 15 restaurants worldwide. Ai Fiori offers managers an opportunity to work with high-quality Italian cuisine and wine/spirits and an operations team firmly committed to investing in and developing talent. Altamarea Group, through its talented team of employees, creates special memories through exceptional hospitality, delivering the highest level of food and service across distinct brands and concepts.  



**Who We’re Looking For**  

We are seeking a dedicated and experienced **Breakfast Lunch** **Floor Manager** to join our team! As the Breakfast Floor Manager, you will oversee the breakfast and lunch team, ensuring guest satisfaction. You will have a passion for hospitality, strong leadership skills, and a commitment to delivering an exceptional dining experience to our guests. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in food & beverage.
  

  

**Responsibilities Include**

* Train, develop, and motivate all staff, with a special emphasis on the Front Door team.
* Organize, supervise and execute shifts during breakfast and lunch, including overseeing scheduling.
* Deliver superior service and optimize client dining experience on a daily, consistent basis.
* Ensure exceptional service standards are upheld during breakfast and lunch shifts.
* Coordinate daily team briefings on menu changes, service standards, and team acknowledgements.
* Monitor cleanliness and set-up within the restaurant.
* Perform other duties as assigned by management.




**Essential Duties**

* Adept with all restaurant technology (reservation management, POS, purchasing, labor-management)
* Candidates should demonstrate creativity and a commitment to brand success
* Demonstrate an emphasis on driving business while improving quality and guest retention.
* Performing high level of customer/guest service and guest interaction by exhibiting a friendly personality and engaging guests consistently.
* Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations in the dining area.
* Administrative duties such as inventory and purchasing.




**Qualifications**

* Effective, respectful, and clear communication skills to staff members, management and guests.
* Strong background in fine dining (ideally Michelin-level service), experience as a Maitre’d, and/or knowledge of service standards
* Must have fine dining experience, Michelin Star experience is a plus.
* Must be capable, trustworthy, have integrity, and have experience deescalating.
* Ability to train, motivate and support restaurant staff.

**What We Offer**


At Altamarea Group, we are committed to creating a supportive and professionally rewarding work environment for all of our team members. We are also pleased to offer the following benefits for our employees:

* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits with wide range of coverage options for families (30 days from date of hire)
* Paid Time Off (progressive with tenure)
* Career Development and Growth Opportunities
* Employee Dining Discount at All Altamarea Group Restaurants
* 401(k) Plan (one year from date of hire)

*Altamarea Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.*

title: Supervisor - Bar Torino
description:
Chef **ANDREW CARMELLINI** is looking for passionate and dedicated **S**UPERVISOR who are eager to learn and join the team.  

  

This is for our new location **BAR TORINO** in Hudson Yards and has tremendous opportunity for growth within our hospitality family.

* Interest in food, wine and spirits culture.

We offer medical, dental, and vision benefits day of hire for full time employees, as well as a 401(k), Paid Time Off, Employee Dining Discount, BRi Commuter Benefits, Flexible Spending Account (FSA) for full time employees, and Referral Reward Program.

*Since first partnering in 2009, chef Andrew Carmellini, Josh Pickard and Luke Ostrom have opened a national portfolio of restaurants and culinary services at preeminent hotels, live music venues and major metropolitan sports arenas and airports across New York City, Detroit, Baltimore and Nashville including Locanda Verde, The Dutch, Joe’s Pub and The Library at The Public, Lafayette, Bar Primi, Leuca, Westlight, Mister Dips, Rec Pier Chop House, The Cannon Room, San Morello, Evening Bar, The Brakeman, Penny Red's, Carne Mare, Café Carmellini and The Portrait Bar. The team actively runs food and beverage operations in five hotels, including The Greenwich Hotel, The William Vale, Sagamore Pendry Baltimore, Shinola Hotel, and The Fifth Avenue Hotel. Known for delivering quality experiences and pertinent culinary culture, each place is a distinctly owned, handcrafted labor of love. They've received widespread critical acclaim, recognition on countless “Best of” lists, a Michelin star, and two coveted James Beard Foundation awards. To learn more, visit nhgnyc.com or AndrewCarmellini.com.* *The pay range for the position is $28 - $30 per hour.*

title: Kitchen Porter
description:
**About Us:**  

Filé Gumbo Bar™ is inspired by the iconic ingredient used to thicken and flavor our gumbo. Filé, pronounced fee-lay, means thread or string in French, and refers to the dried and ground leaves of the North American sassafras tree.


The centerpiece of our menu is Tiny’s Gumbo™, inspired by the owner’s grandfather, Aubrey “Tiny” Gaines (who was anything but). Tiny had a larger-than-life presence, and believed there was nothing better than shellfish and spice.  

  

We have just been named by Eater NY, The City's Best Gumbo!

**Kitchen Porter**  

**Job Summary:**  

* Cleaning: Cleaning floors, walls, and equipment, including restrooms, kitchen areas, and storage areas
* Sanitizing: Sanitizing kitchen areas, including ovens, grills, sinks, and stoves
* Deliveries: Unloading and organizing food and equipment deliveries
* Waste removal: Taking out the garbage and properly disposing of kitchen waste
* Dishwashing: Washing dishes, cutlery, and cookware


Porter should be able to:  

* Move freely in and out of a busy kitchen
* Carry up to 50 pounds
* Clean and move continuously for several hours at a time
* Be comfortable on ladders
* Stand, kneel, stretch, and squat

Should be detailed oriented, be a team player and willing to help with anything

title: Sommelier
description:
**Position Purpose:** this person is responsible for ensuring quality and consistency of the restaurant’s beverage program, maintaining, and enhancing service, and educating the staff. This person will work alongside the rest of the management team, striving to constantly improve the guest experience.




**Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities**:

**Logistics**

* Responsible for departmental logistics efficiency – monitor what works and what doesn’t and offer ideas to achieve the expected outcome – examples include increase of wine sales, cellar organization, re-stocking system, deliveries, etc.

• Assist in and conduct wine training of new hired and existing staff and materials generation • Monitor and spot check wine deliveries and BIN # assignment, proper storage and organization of the wine cellar




**Dining Room Service**

* Offer wine expertise, guide guests about wine and oversee service in the entire restaurant by being present on the floor
* Present, represent and offer wine suggestions to all guests, execute wine service step by step
* Support dining room staff with any wine related and service related issues
* Personalize service by leading by example - using guest’s name, building relationships with loyal guests, checking on satisfaction by being involved and touching every single table
* Build guest loyalty by creating and maintaining guest preference notes related to wine consumption and enjoyment (with assistance of host team), record all guest notes in OpenTable database.




**Product Presentation & Staff Education**

* Monitor and make sure quality of wine is at its highest.
* Monitor the quality and par levels of wine glassware and decanters.
* Train and guide staff on proper bottle presentation, decanting and pouring, making sure the correct verbiage is used at all times – organize short daily pre-shift trainings and tastings, make sure there is a wine class scheduled once a month.
* Assist in and conduct wine training of new hired and existing staff and materials generation.
* Communicate wine lows, 86's and info on new wines to staff.




**Inventory Management and Administrative**

* Maintain an inventory system using our programs that allows you to have maximum control over movement of bottles from and to several storage areas.
* Responsible for full liquor and wine inventory on the last day of every month.
* Conduct monthly beverage inventory.
* Maintain and update internal wine inventory sheets after weekly counts are completed.
* Ensure accuracy of wines on all menus, wine list and POS postings.
* Communicate all wine changes and pricing updates to corporate wine department and corporate design team to update and print wine menus.
* Make sure all menus that contain wines by the glass are updated to reflect any changes.
* Communicate all changes in timely manner - keys for wines in Aloha, which are linked to active inventory numbers.
* Make sure all wines that are removed from the list are de-activated and taken out of Aloha, inform corporate wine department of all changes.
* In absence of receiver, fully handle everything related to wine – deliveries, invoices, putting bottles away, etc.




**Financial & Legal**

* Maximize financial performance and profit – suggest promotions and bring revenue increase ideas, train staff on up selling, build guest loyalty by touching every single table, build relationships with all guests that dine at our locations.
* Execute and take responsibility for results of beverage inventories.
* If asked, assist in purchasing of beverage.
* Enforce federal, state and local laws including alcohol consumption, including training and enforcing of minimum drinking age requirement, TIPs training, etc.
* Maintain the safety and security of all employees, guests, and company assets.




**Self-Development**

It is understood that as Sommelier you are responsible to maintain current knowledge of the world of wines. You will be required to continually develop this knowledge on your own time and stay on top of current industry and wine trends. Your progress in education will be evaluated on ongoing basis. Likewise, the company will assist in any way possible with any educational goals that relate to your duties as Sommelier (with prior management approval)




**Minimal Essential Requirements:**

* The ability to work as part of a team, and personal cleanliness.
* Very basic food handling, preparation, and cleaning skills are welcomed.
* Time management and ability to work under pressure to manage high volume of production.
* Active listening and learning skills.
* Reading and speaking comprehension skills
* Discipline to follow set standards.
* Ability to lift up to 30lbs.

  

ADA: SA Hospitality Group will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.


This job description will be reviewed periodically as duties and responsibilities change with business necessity. Essential and marginal job functions are subject to modification.

title: Assistant General Manager
description:
**About Restaurant Marc Forgione**

In his eponymous restaurant, Chef Marc Forgione showcases his innovative yet approachable New American cuisine using the best seasonal and local ingredients. Opened in 2008 in TriBeCa Restaurant Marc Forgione attracts an eclectic mix of locals and visitors who come for the contemporary food and drink with friendly service in a comfortable setting.  

As the son of renowned chef Larry Forgione, Chef Marc Forgione has been developing his skills in the kitchen since he was 16 years old, first at his father’s restaurant An American Place and then with notable chefs Kazuto Matsusaka, Patricia Yeo, Michel Guerard and Laurent Tourondel.
  

  

From these varied experiences, Forgione has created a straightforward American style with bold flavors and playful touches. Menus change frequently to showcase fresh ingredients, local farmers and purveyors, and new twists on seasonal American favorites.


The General Manager of the restaurant directs and oversees all operations in accordance with standardized policies to ensure the restaurant runs smoothly daily, best practices are in place to drive revenue and profitability and acts as the leader to drive the culture and morale of the team.

**What we are looking for:**

* A passionate Assistant General Manager
* Excellent communication skills
* A passion for food, wine, and service
* A strong sense of urgency while exuding a calm demeanor
* A desire to learn and grow
* Ability to connect with new guests and maintain greatest relationships with regulars
* A strong attention to detail
* Multiple years experience working in a high-caliber restaurant

**What we can offer:**

* An opportunity to join in on a new restaurant opening
* The ability to work team full of talented professionals
* Internal growth opportunities
* Option to join our Medical, Dental and Vision plans ( full time employees)
* Commuter Benefits (full time and part time employees)

*Respect Hospitality is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Host/ess
description:
**About Ai Fiori**  

Highly-acclaimed Ai Fiori, from famed hospitality firm Altamarea Group and located at the Langham New York Hotel, is looking for energetic, passionate, and professional hosts and hostesses to join the team. Ai Fiori showcases modern interpretations of cuisine from the French and Italian Riviera and offers employees the opportunity to work with quality Italian cuisine & wine/spirits, a respectful, safe, professional work environment, and a management team uniquely invested in the growth and success of all team members.




**Host / Hostess Responsibilities include:**

* Greet upon arrival and interact with guests in a professional, warm and courteous manner and develop guest relationships
* Navigate reservations platform and client database proficiently
* Exhibit knowledge of Ai Fiori’s menus, culinary style and concept, reservations policies, operating hours, and other facts about the restaurants and be able to address common guest inquiries
* Handle various guest interactions, including but not limited to reservations, confirmation calls, guest reservation requests, and pick-up/delivery requests
* Maintain clean dining room and restaurant and adhere to all health and safety standards




**Host / Hostess Requirements include:**

* Substantive host and reservationist experience preferred
* Genuine passion for restaurant hospitality and service
* Energetic and friendly personality, with strong willingness and ability to work as part of a cohesive team and to support colleagues regardless of role, and a positive communication style
* Ability to multi-task and perform in high-volume, high-intensity restaurant
* Physical requirements include: ability to handle and carry trays, smallware, equipment, or other items up to 35lbs, and to stand, walk up and down stairs, and exert well-paced mobility for extended period of time
* Flexible schedule and open availability to meet business needs

  

**Qualifications**

  
* Must be able to communicate with guests effectively and respectfully.
* Flexible schedule including weekends, mornings, and evenings.
* Be able to walk, stand, bend, lift, point, kneel, for long periods of time.

**What We Offer**

At Altamarea Group, we are committed to creating a supportive and professionally rewarding work environment for all of our team members. We are also pleased to offer the following benefits for our employees:

* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits with wide range of coverage options for families (30 days from date of hire)
* Paid Time Off (progressive with tenure)
* Career Development and Growth Opportunities
* Employee Dining Discount at All Altamarea Group Restaurants
* 401(k) Plan (one year from date of hire)

*Altamarea Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.*

title: Finance Coordinator
description:
**Job Title: Finance Coordinator**

As a Finance Coordinator, you will play a vital role in our finance team, contributing to essential functions across accounts payable, payroll, and accounts receivable.

**Essential Functions:**

**Accounts Payable:**

**Invoice Management:** 

Your role will involve managing invoice approvals and processing them efficiently. You’ll handle the entire workflow from receiving invoices to recording them in the system.

**Vendor Relationships:** 

**Weekly Payment Runs:** 

**Employee Expense Reimbursements:** 

In this role, you will also handle employee expense reimbursements, ensuring that all claims are processed in a timely manner and in compliance with company policies.

**New Vendor Onboarding:** 

You’ll be responsible for onboarding new vendors, ensuring that all necessary documentation is completed and that vendors are set up in the system correctly.

**Annual Audit Support:** 

Assisting with the annual audit process is a crucial part of this role. You’ll ensure that all financial records related to accounts payable are accurate and readily available for audit review.

**Accounts Receivable:**

Ensuring timely collections is critical. You’ll follow up on outstanding invoices and work with customers to resolve any payment issues.

**I**

**Payroll:**

**Payroll Processing:** 

A major component of your role is ensuring accurate payroll processing, particularly during high season when the volume of work increases. This includes managing payroll for all employees and ensuring timely compensation.

**Tax Compliance:** 

Ensuring payroll tax compliance and reporting is a key responsibility. You’ll manage tax-related processes and ensure that all filings are completed accurately and on time

**Qualifications**

**Educational Background:**

A Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field is required.

**Experience:**

3-5 years of experience in finance or accounting roles, with a strong focus on accounts payable, payroll, and accounts receivable. Experience in managing financial operations during high seasons or periods of increased activity is highly desirable

**Technical Proficiency:**

Proficiency in using financial and accounting software (NetSuite a plus), including Google Suite, Microsoft Office (particularly Excel), CRM systems (Salesforce a plus), and other relevant tools. Ability to maintain accurate records and manage documentation efficiently.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Accounts receivable: 2 years (Preferred)
* Accounts payable: 2 years (Preferred)
* Payroll: 1 year (Preferred)
* Netsuite: 1 year (Required)
* Vendor management: 2 years (Preferred)

title: Property Services Administrator
description:
**COMPANY SUMMARY**  

Empire State Realty Trust, Inc. (NYSE: ESRT) is a NYC-focused REIT that owns and operates a portfolio of modernized, amenitized, and well-located office, retail, and multifamily assets and the Observatory deck attraction in ESRT’s flagship Empire State Building – the “World’s Most Famous Building”. The Company is the recognized leader in energy efficiency and indoor environmental quality. As of March 31, 2024, ESRT's portfolio is comprised of approximately 8.6 million rentable square feet of office space, 0.7 million rentable square feet of retail space and 727 residential units. More information about Empire State Realty Trust can be found at esrtreit.com and by following ESRT on Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, X, and LinkedIn.  

The dedicated team at ESRT is a collection of diverse individuals with a shared passion for excellence and a keen eye toward future growth. Headquartered in New York City, we harness the energy of the city in everything we do. We care for one another, work hard, and have a lot of fun doing it! We are Certified™ as a Great Place to Work® by the global authority, Great Place to Work®, on workplace culture, employee experience, and leadership behaviors. We prioritize and invest in the health and wellness of employees to attract, develop, and retain top-tier talent. ESRT values continuous employee development and encourages colleagues to excel in their roles and adapt to emerging business needs. From our crown jewel, The Empire State Building, to incredible buildings modernized for the 21st century, to outstanding customer service, and our decade-long leadership position in sustainability and energy efficient portfolio that is 100% fully powered by renewable wind electricity, we take pride in our work. ESRT seeks an equally passionate colleague to join the team, understand the vision and help achieve that vision. **POSITION SUMMARY**  

The Property Services Administrator (PSA) provides administrative support to the property manager(s) and building office management staff. The PSA is also responsible for Delivering exceptional customer service for tenants, leasing, management and vendors with effective communication skills, a strong ability to manage multiple functions accurately, and follow the ESRT Customer Service Promise. The PSA is also a highly motivated individual responsible for phone support, work orders and invoice processing.
### **RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Acts as the first point of contact for tenants with service requests (primarily through the building’s electronic service request system, Building Engines)
* Be an ESRT + ambassador
* Integrate, answer questions, and work to solve issues including, but not limited to: schedule photo IDs where applicable until full electronic integration, issue access cards, and routine usage of overtime freight elevators, dumpsters, conference room reservations, loading dock usage, and overtime air conditioning and heating
* Notify tenants of building wide activities, maintain current information databases in tenant emergency book, rules, and regulations, and needs of the Management Office
* Function as a liaison between tenants and vendors and/or contractors, in routine situations
* Respect and maintain privacy of agency clients, always assuring client confidentiality
* Provide efficient and professional telephone service
* Provide professional and courteous demeanor to tenants, clients, brokers, and co-workers
* Keep track of calendars, ongoing projects, and maintain work order notices and the tenant access card system
* Generate nightly/weekend Security and after-hours memos for each property
* Maintain accurate documentation and files of all contractors, tenants, and vendors insurance through the Jones system
* Ensure all seeking to work in buildings have current certificates of insurance that meet building requirements (confirm certificate holder is correct, and vendor meets required limits – refer to sample COI), and coordinate vendor access with Security
* Track and maintain all building and tenant files, tenant charges, tenant and vendor contact information, and validates the accuracy of logs and records
* Coordinate and attend bi-annual tenant meetings per standard operating procedures
* Document tenant meetings in Tenant Meeting Log and ensure any action items are followed-up on until completion
* Arrange maintenance of all business office machines, in coordination with office services (maintains forms and office supplies as needed)
* Review leases to determine provisions as they relate to landlord vs. tenant responsibilities, so the tenants receive what is required and are billed as required for additional services per their lease
* Coordinate the move in/out process and works closely with building staff to ensure an easy transition
* Review and process all operations-related paperwork regarding purchasing goods and services pursuant to ESRT’s standard purchasing procedures – expenses for all vendors
* Research all outstanding/unpaid bills and take appropriate steps to resolve the issue
* Prepare all required Jobs, Budget Electronic, Budget Revisions, Contracts, Change Orders, etc. for building specific projects
* Investigate and resolve all outstanding or unpaid operations-related bills
* Process invoices for operating expenses through Yardi
* Process service contracts through Yardi service contract module
* Maintain Service Contract log with all contracts increases and various expiration dates
* Assist, as directed, with the budget preparation (i.e., reviewing contracts for escalations, obtaining proposals for forecasting, gathering data as necessary)
* Assist Property Manager in the preparation of annual operating budgets, as relates to service contracts
* Assist in the monthly operating/capital accrual reporting, quarterly Tenant Commitment reporting, quarterly Variance Analyses
* Provide all requested information quickly and accurately and maintain communication with other administrative staff (as well as other staff) staff to exchange information and methods of work
* Support the property management staff (Property Manager, Assistant Property Manager, Project Managers, Director of Housekeeping, Operations Team, etc.) with all day-to-day administrative duties
* Works on projects and administrative work as requested
* Complete weekly payroll through ADP and serve as back-up to other administrative staff as needed (absence, lunch, break coverage, etc.)
* Shift to other properties in the portfolio as needed (reporting to properties within Manhattan)

### **WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE**

* Be Self Driven
* Be Punctual and Present
* Have a growth mind set and accept constructive feedback
* Communication with tenants, leasing, and property management

### **REQUIRED SKILLS / ABILITIES**

* Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint
* Excellent communication (written and oral)

### **EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**

* Two to three years prior administrative experience in the Real Estate industry preferred
* Knowledge of accounting and Real Estate software is a plus

### **PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times

### **WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT**

* At ESRT, like our tenants, our employees come from everywhere. We foster a richly diverse work environment that captures top talent and cultivates the best ideas. By focusing on inclusion and celebrating our differences, we create even greater value — in business practices, relationships, and employee engagement. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to maintaining a diverse, inclusive and equitable work environment where our employees can thrive. In addition, ESRT employees embody our Company Culture & Success Factors:
* **Adaptable** – you are a self-starter who’s able to quickly digest and execute new processes to work both collaboratively and independently
* **Dynamic** – you are solutions-oriented, aim to improve processes and implement efficiency, and offer insightful feedback to improve ESRT
* **Dependable** – you take a strong sense of ownership and accountability over your work
* **Passionate** – you keep up with industry trends and are excited about the potential to propel the industry forward with a “roll-up-your-sleeves” attitude
* **Curious** – you consistently look for new ways to work smarter, not just harder
* **Ethical** – you treat others with respect, and embrace and contribute to a culture of diversity and inclusion
* **Positive** – you possess a service-oriented attitude with excellent follow through

### **BENEFITS**

* Competitive base salary and bonus
* Health/Dental/Vision insurance
* Company sponsored Life, AD&D, STD (with Salary Continuation), and LTD Insurance
* Voluntary Enhanced LTD Program
* Voluntary Hospital, Accident, and Cancer Programs
* 401(k) with 100% match up to 5%
* Paid parental leave
* Pre-tax transit accounts
* Employee Assistance Program for emotional, financial, and legal support

### **WELL-BEING**

* Generous paid time off
* Flex remote work time
* Flex Summer Fridays
* Employee engagement programs
* Volunteer time off
* Continuing education
* Complimentary Empire State Building Observatory access
* Complimentary gym membership and other wellness benefits
* Employee Discount Programs


Salary is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, job location, size of property where applicable, and/or certifications. In addition to your base salary, ESRT provides discretionary annual bonuses.
ESRT is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We celebrate the unique differences of our employees because they drive curiosity, innovation, and the success of our business. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy, parental status, caregiver status, genetic information, political affiliation, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation, training, working conditions, transfer, job assignments, benefits, layoff, and termination. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities

title: Project Coordinator
description:
**About Us:**

Digacore Consulting is a technology consulting firm that offers Managed IT Support Services to our clients. We are currently seeking a Full-time Project Coordinator to join our growing and talented team. At Digacore, we take pride in maintaining the highest standards of customer service and providing technical solutions that optimize our client's business goals. Our overarching goal is to foster a work environment filled with individuals who are growth-oriented, possess a 'get it done' attitude, and understand the value of teamwork and healthy interactions with both clients and co-workers. The ideal candidate for this role is someone with a natural aptitude for coordination and organization, a strong team player, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

**Job duties:**

As a Project Coordinator, your responsibilities include coordinating various phases and stages of client projects and ensuring effective communication between internal teams and clients. You will collaborate with staff and vendor support resources, facilitating project completion and issue resolution under the guidance of the Project Manager. Your role involves supporting the implementation of technology solutions and maintaining comprehensive project documentation.

* Assist in understanding client business needs and managing client expectations.
* Coordinate project development and deployment, including site surveys.
* Collaborate with internal teams such as Procurement, Hardware Development, Technicians, and Sales Teams.
* Facilitate seamless communication between all variables throughout the project life cycle.
* Schedule onsite visits and transitions, coordinating with third-party technicians and vendors.
* Coordinate with third-party vendors.
* Aid in allocating resources and delegating tasks to Project team technicians.
* Support in managing project team technicians.
* Assist in scheduling project timelines and ensuring deadlines are met.
* Track the progress of projects and provide updates to management.
* Participate in creating and maintaining comprehensive project documentation.
* Support in ensuring projects stay within budget.
* Identify potential risks and contribute to developing effective risk management techniques.
* All other tasks as assigned.

**Skills Required:**

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong organizational skills.
* Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
* Understanding of business operations and effective team coordination skills.
* Strong oral and written communication skills as a team player.
* Proficiency in Microsoft applications, including Excel.
* SharePoint is a plus.
* 1-year experience in any ticketing system, not mandatory.
* A willingness to be dedicated to project requirements with schedule flexibility.
* A desire and eagerness to continuously learn and train for constant improvement in knowledge, experience, and skills.

**Digacore Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer!**

title: Field Sales Trainer
description:
We are New Jersey’s largest wine and spirits distributor looking for great people to join our team! If you are interested in joining a great company in the beverage industry, then come join our fun, family based culture. **Why You Will Love Allied Beverage Group**
Industry Leader – We are New Jersey’s Largest Wine and Spirits Distributor
Culture – We may be a big corporation, but we are still family owned and we like to think that influences our work environment. We promote a culture based on trust, respect and collaboration
State of the Art Facility – We opened a brand-new corporate office and distribution center in Elizabeth, NJ in 2019
Your Continued Growth – Our company encourages our employees to reach high, live up to their potential, and advance in their careers. We offer over 9,000 professional development courses that employees can take at any time
Competitive Pay – Allied Beverage Group offers competitive pay commensurate with experience
Quality Benefits – Including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plan, Life Insurance, Long Term Disability, Flexible Spending Account, Employee Assistance Program, Pet Insurance Plan and more
Allied Perks! – Associate recognition, discounts with several vendors and more **Overview**

Under the Director of Learning & Development, the Field Sales Trainer is essential for training and developing New Hire and Experienced Sales Associates at Allied Beverage Group. This role involves leading New Hire Field Sales Training and Allied Selling Sales Training Programs, conducting engaging in-class sessions, and providing on-the-job coaching to help participants succeed. Key responsibilities include analyzing and enhancing existing training programs, developing training materials (decks, videos, job aids), and offering feedback to participants. The Trainer will also engage with the Commercial Team through Sales Meetings and Supplier Trainings.

As part of the Learning & Development Department, the Field Sales Trainer supports initiatives like the Building Leaders Coaching Program and Lunch & Learn events. Additionally, the role allows for creating a customized Talent Development Plan in collaboration with the Director of Learning & Development, aimed at enhancing skills and professional networking.
### **Responsibilities**

* Field-based Training and Coaching Days – Work with Sales Associates in market 3 days per week to train and/or coach with the purpose of elevating knowledge and developing skills.
* New Hire Sales Training and Feedback Reporting – Facilitate New Hire Sales Training Programs and complete recaps to provide feedback to program participants, managers and the Learning & Development team.
* Sales Training Program Leadership & Facilitation – Lead and facilitate training sessions and/or breakouts for Sales Training Programs.
* L&D Program Support & Professional Development – Support L&D Programs and Initiatives. Complete training, stretch assignments and/or mentoring/coaching to elevate knowledge and skills and stay current on trends in training and skill set development
* Needs Assessments & Cross-Functional Communication – Identify needs and/or opportunities to elevate current sales training programs or create new programs or modules

### **Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
* Valid driver’s license
* Strong understanding of sales processes; knowledge of the beverage alcohol industry and New Jersey wine & spirits market preferred
* Required experience in sales, field marketing, or account management; route or territory sales in wine & spirits preferred
* Required experience in training or facilitation; experience in consumer products or beverage alcohol training preferred
* Experience creating and delivering training in various formats (in-person, virtual, blended) preferred
* Management or coaching experience a plus; one-on-one coaching preferred
* Experience with LMS platforms a plus
* Leadership qualities: integrity, confidence, people-oriented, self-motivated, effective time management, analytical skills, and strong communication skills
* Training & Coaching: content creation, presentation, and facilitation skills; strong interpersonal and active listening abilities
* Technical skills: proficiency in Microsoft Office 365; experience with LMS platforms (e.g., Cornerstone, SuccessFactors) and virtual conferencing tools (e.g., Teams, Zoom) preferred; CRM experience (e.g., Salesforce, Veeva) a plus
* Certifications: Training/Teaching or Facilitation certification preferred; Coaching certification a plus; WSET Level 2 (or higher) in Wine and/or Spirits a plus


The Company is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our team members and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct a drug and background check for all new team members post-offer and prior to the start of employment. The Immigration Reform and Control Act requires that verification of employment eligibility be documented for all new employees by the end of the third day of work.  

EEO Statement  

Allied Beverage Group is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information and other legally protected characteristics.

Quality Benefits – Including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plan, Life Insurance, Long Term Disability, Flexible Spending Account, Employee Assistance Program, Pet Insurance Plan and more
Allied Perks! – Associate recognition, discounts with several vendors and more **This is a temporary position.**  

The primary purpose of this job is to foster the merchandising, promotion, and the selling of concept to assist sell-thru of the specific products chosen by client suppliers. This job will be conducted in the Off-Premise Accounts (Retail Stores) of Allied Beverage Group, via a list assigned by the manager. The accounts will be assigned via a route list by the merchandising manager. The accounts will be visited a minimum of twice a month.
### **Responsibilities**

* P.O.S. installation for the products of our Client Suppliers (floor displays, hanging displays, counter displays, shelf talkers, interior displays, and window signs and displays)
* Order in-house produced P.O.S. from Graphics Department when needed.
* Shelf management for existing client products and new product introduction
* Rebate coupon distribution, installation, and removal upon expiration
* Cold-box management for client supplier’s products
* Restocking of shelves, cold-box, and displays
* Log all efforts in an excel spreadsheet as required
* Take digital or conventional pictures of efforts as outlined by the Merchandising Manager and e-mail the pictures daily to the Merchandising Manager
* Check e-mail regularly during workday via Smartphone or iPad and reply to all e-mail within As soon as possible

 **On a regular basis preferably not less than every two days:*** Forward via e-mail or post on Drop Box any requested reports, surveys, trackers, and back-up documentation pictures

 **Occasionally, the Merchandiser will be required to:*** Conduct a data survey by size, price, or shelf position of specified product(s)
* Assist in New Store product shelf placement and floor display set up of ABG products, as well as unloading trucks.
* Assist in existing store make-overs and resets with product shelf placement and floor display set up of ABG products
* Delivery product in a company vehicle with a NJ transit insignia
* Set up displays and P.O.S. at trade shows
* Help train new hires

### **Qualifications**

* College Degree
* Experience in Sales & Marketing
* 2-4 years of experience with a background in Marketing/Business
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Windows
* Outgoing and personable
* Sales-oriented personality
* Must possess a valid New Jersey Driver’s License


The Company is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our team members and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct a drug and background check for all new team members post-offer and prior to the start of employment. The Immigration Reform and Control Act requires that verification of employment eligibility be documented for all new employees by the end of the third day of work.  

EEO Statement  

Allied Beverage Group is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information and other legally protected characteristics.

title: Manager, CSC Operations
description:
A leader in technology and innovation, Southwire Company, LLC is one of North America’s largest wire and cable producers. Southwire and its subsidiaries manufacture building wire and cable, utility products, metal-clad cable, portable and electronic cord products, OEM wire products and engineered products. In addition, Southwire supplies assembled products, contractor equipment, electrical components, hand tools and jobsite power and lighting solutions. The company also offers digital solutions including contractor planning and utility grid resiliency as well as field services including cable testing, rejuvenation and replacement to support our customers as a value-add partner. We are proud to offer competitive compensation, employee benefits, tuition reimbursement and unlimited growth opportunities. Our more than seven decades of progressive growth can be attributed to our determination to developing innovative systems and solutions, exercising environmental stewardship and enhancing the well-being of the communities in which we work and live. How will you power what’s possible?


Location: Monroe Township, NJ

**Southwire Job Description**
-----------------------------


The site leader is responsible for all performance objectives of the site and for driving continuous improvement while developing the site leadership team at the Customer Service Center (CSC) located in Monroe Township, New Jersey.

  

Key Responsibilities

* Manage all distribution services including receiving, storing, shipping, handling returned/damaged goods, maintenance, and administrative activities to ensure customer requirements are met.
* Utilize lean tools daily to ensure continuous improvement of all KPIs. This is inclusive of safety, quality, customer service, cost, inventory, security, and team member engagement.
* Conduct operations in a manner that promotes safety in compliance with OHSA & Southwire standards.
* Continuously improve our customer experience through innovative service offerings and performance in collaboration with sales organization.
* Create long-range labor needs based upon demand forecasts and sponsor the leadership team to execute on plans.
* Develop programs to improve operations and present business case to senior leadership.
* Direct the leadership team and operations warehouse team members to achieve prescribed objectives.
* Develop and oversee all team members to ensure an efficient and cost-effective operation.
* Apply sound communication and motivational techniques in leading, supervising, and coaching.
* Through personal leadership, ensure that a positive and efficient work environment is created and maintained.

  

Qualifications and Experience Requirements  

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering, business administration or related degree preferred.
* 5+ years of proven operations or distribution management experience required.
* Prior operations manager or value stream manager experience is preferred.
* Must have a comprehensive knowledge of all warehouse operations.
* Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills along with exceptional interpersonal skills.
* Must be able to interface and communicate effectively within the organization, with business units throughout the company, and with external customers/agents.
**Competencies**
----------------


Drives Results
Business Insights
Values Differences
Manages Complexity
Communicates Effectively
Manages Ambiguity
Benefits We Offer:

* 401k with Matching
* Family and Individual Insurance Packages (Health, Life, Dental, and Vision)
* Paid Time Off & Paid Holidays
* Long & Short-Term Disability
* Supplemental Insurance Plans
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Referral Program
* Tuition Reimbursement Programs
* Advancement & Professional Growth opportunities
* Parental Leave
* & More


Southwire is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
